intro: Fagara stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small, dark seeds. Fagara stenophylla is often found in understory habitats and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native ecosystems.
